chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: That's right!  I would never glue anything to my crotch!
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions add "丰" (象艸木) under "丵", and the structure of the font is similar to " Feng " and " Bang ". After the land was opened up, the boundary was established. The pre-Qin Dynasty established the boundary mostly by planting trees. The original meaning of " right " is to divide the land, plant trees in the soil, and establish the boundary, and then use the meaning of response and response. "poetry. Daya. "Emperor": "The emperor makes a country and opposes it", which means that the emperor opens up a state and territory. Gao Heng’s "Book of Songs Jin Zhu" said: "To make, to create, it is extended to the meaning of pioneering. State, borrowed to seal. Seal, border area. Yes, agree with Xinjiang. Ancient countries often planted trees on borders as signs, slightly Like the wicker edge of the offspring, this is called right." "Huang Jin" later said: "Being benevolent to Zhou Hu, and to the world" also means to open up the world.

"Shuowen" Xiaozhuan added from " mouth ". It may be a differentiated character created for responding and answering " right ", but this word has not been handed down. Later generations still use the word " right " (Ji Xusheng). The word " pair " in the Han silk script is the meaning symbol from " yan ". "Said Wen": "𡭊, Xun has no right. Congquan, Congkou, Congcun. Yes, (对)[𡭊] or Congshi. The Emperor of Hanwen thought: the responsibility is right and the words are not honest, so go His mouth is to follow the scholar." From the Jia Jin inscription, the " shi " is regarded as the error of the " earth ."

Liu Zhao believes " Zhuo " from "䇂" evolved, "䇂" as one kind of instrument of torture. Gao Hongjin said that "丵" is an ancient weapon with teeth.

Oracle is suspected to be used as a sacrificial name or place name. Jin Wen said to answer and thank you, Da Yuding: "Yes to Wang Xiu." Lu Fangding: "To Yang Wang Xiu", to express repay and praise Zhou Wang's shelter. "The Book of Songs. Daya. "Jiang Han": "To Yang Wang Xiu". Also used as a name.

The Han silk book expresses the answer, "Mawangdui silk book. Line 362 of the Old Unused Book after the First Volume of Lao Zi: "Yi Yin said in contrast."
humanum_short_description_en: A text from " and " from " Zhuo " from " soil " Bing contends that the " Zhuo " Down " soil this form" is also a sound character, " Zhuo " as hammering tool, a word like hand tool to open up the land.
humanum_full_description:
金文在「丵」下加「丰」(象艸木)，字形結構與「封」、「邦」字相近。因為開闢土地之後，要樹立地界，先秦樹立地界多半以植樹為之，「對」的本義是闢地分疆，植樹於土，立下地界，後假借為應對、應答之意。《詩．大雅．皇矣》：「帝作邦作對」，表示帝開闢邦國、開闢領土。高亨《詩經今註》曰：「作，創造也，引申為開拓之義。邦，借用封。封，邊疆也。對，與疆同意。古代國家常在邊界上種植樹木以作標志，略似後代的柳條邊，這叫做對。」〈皇矣〉後文云：「以篤于周祜，以對于天下」，也是開闢天下的意思。

　　《說文》小篆加從「口」，可能是為應對、對答的「對」的而造的分化字，只是這個字沒有流傳下來，後世仍然用「對」字(季旭昇)。漢帛書應對的「對」字從「言」為意符。《說文》：「𡭊，譍無方也。从丵、从口、从寸。對，(對)[𡭊]或从士。漢文帝以爲：責對而爲言，多非誠對，故去其口以从士也。」從甲金文來看，「士」當為「土」之訛。

　　劉釗認為「丵」是從「䇂」演變而來，「䇂」象一種刑具。高鴻縉謂「丵」象有齒之古兵器。

　　甲骨文疑用作祭名或地名。金文表示對答、答謝，大盂鼎：「用對王休」。呂方鼎：「對揚王休」，表示報答、稱揚周王的蔭庇。《詩經．大雅．江漢》：「對揚王休」。又用作人名。

　　漢帛書表示對答，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本卷後古佚書》第362行：「伊尹對曰」。
humanum_short_description: 甲文從「又」從「丵」從「土」，陳秉新認為上「丵」下「土」此形亦是聲符，「丵」象鑿擊工具，字象手持工具開闢土地。

English Definition: right; correct; couple; pair; towards; at; for; to face; opposite; to treat (sb a certain way); to match together; to adjust; to fit; to suit; to answer; to reply; classifier: couple
Antonyms: 錯 誤

    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny

dui4
HSK 2: 對,对
HSK 4: 队,隊
HSK 5: 兌,兑
對對RS
对对 		correct, right, facing, opposed
  • the law spoken by the king 王 stands 业 above all else, big 丷 and small 寸
  • ⓢ two hands 寸 又 correcting something
  • ⓢ correct again 又 therefore deserve a thump up 寸
(Simplified: 对)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 錯 誤
Ideographic: A hand 寸 holding a lit 业 candelabrum 羊
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⿱ Above to below
      • 业 [ yè ] business, profession; to study, to work
      • 羊 [ yáng ] sheep, goat
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
①答，答話，回答：對答如流。無言以對。
②朝着：對酒當歌。
③處於相反方向的：對面。
④跟，和：對他商量一下。
⑤互相，彼此相向地：對立。對流。對接。對稱(chèn)。對峙。
⑥說明事物的關係：對於。對這事有意見。
⑦看待，應付：對待。
⑧照着樣檢查：覈對。校(jiào)對。
⑨投合，適合，使相合：對應(yìng)。對勁。
⑩正確，正常，表肯定的答語：神色不對。
⑾雙，成雙的：配對。對偶。對仗(律詩、駢文等按照字音的平仄和字義做成對偶的語句)。
⑿平分，一半：對開。
⒀攙和(多指液體)：對水。
⒁量詞，雙：一對鸚鵡。

對象 [ duì xiàng ]: target; object; partner; boyfriend; girlfriend; Classifiers: 个
對方 [ duì fāng ]: counterpart; other person involved; opposite side; other side; receiving party

Chinese: Are you sure you want these paintings side by side and upside down, and glued to the wall? That's right!
Meaning: that's right
Hanzi: 对
Story: That's right! I would never glue anything to my crotch!
Kind: traditional

金文在「 丵 」下加「 丰 」(象艸木)，字形結構與「 封 」、「 邦 」字相近。因為開闢土地之後，要樹立地界，先秦樹立地界多半以植樹為之，「 對 」的本義是闢地分疆，植樹於土，立下地界，後假借為應對、應答之意。《詩．大雅．皇矣》：「帝作邦作對」，表示帝開闢邦國、開闢領土。高亨《詩經今註》曰：「作，創造也，引申為開拓之義。邦，借用封。封，邊疆也。對，與疆同意。古代國家常在邊界上種植樹木以作標志，略似後代的柳條邊，這叫做對。」〈皇矣〉後文云：「以篤于周祜，以對于天下」，也是開闢天下的意思。 《說文》小篆加從「 口 」，可能是為應對、對答的「 對 」的而造的分化字，只是這個字沒有流傳下來，後世仍然用「 對 」字(季旭昇)。漢帛書應對的「 對 」字從「 言 」為意符。《說文》：「𡭊，譍無方也。从丵、从口、从寸。對，(對)[𡭊]或从士。漢文帝以爲：責對而爲言，多非誠對，故去其口以从士也。」從甲金文來看，「 士 」當為「 土 」之訛。 劉釗認為「 丵 」是從「 䇂 」演變而來，「 䇂 」象一種刑具。高鴻縉謂「 丵 」象有齒之古兵器。 甲骨文疑用作祭名或地名。金文表示對答、答謝，大盂鼎：「用對王休」。呂方鼎：「對揚王休」，表示報答、稱揚周王的蔭庇。《詩經．大雅．江漢》：「對揚王休」。又用作人名。 漢帛書表示對答，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本卷後古佚書》第362行：「伊尹對曰」。
Bronze inscriptions add " 丰" (象艸木) under " 丵", and the structure of the font is similar to " Feng" and " Bang". After the land was opened up, the boundary was established. The pre-Qin Dynasty established the boundary mostly by planting trees. The original meaning of " right" is to divide the land, plant trees in the soil, and establish the boundary, and then use the meaning of response and response. "poetry. Daya. "Emperor": "The emperor makes a country and opposes it", which means that the emperor opens up a state and territory. Gao Heng’s "Book of Songs Jin Zhu" said: "To make, to create, it is extended to the meaning of pioneering. State, borrowed to seal. Seal, border area. Yes, agree with Xinjiang. Ancient countries often planted trees on borders as signs, slightly Like the wicker edge of the offspring, this is called right." "Huang Jin" later said: "Being benevolent to Zhou Hu, and to the world" also means to open up the world. "Shuowen" Xiaozhuan added from " mouth". It may be a differentiated character created for responding and answering " right", but this word has not been handed down. Later generations still use the word " right" (Ji Xusheng). The word " pair" in the Han silk script is the meaning symbol from " yan". "Said Wen": "𡭊, Xun has no right. Congquan, Congkou, Congcun. Yes, (对)[𡭊] or Congshi. The Emperor of Hanwen thought: the responsibility is right and the words are not honest, so go His mouth is to follow the scholar." From the Jia Jin inscription, the " shi" is regarded as the error of the " earth." Liu Zhao believes " Zhuo" from " 䇂" evolved, " 䇂" as one kind of instrument of torture. Gao Hongjin said that " 丵" is an ancient weapon with teeth. Oracle is suspected to be used as a sacrificial name or place name. Jin Wen said to answer and thank you, Da Yuding: "Yes to Wang Xiu." Lu Fangding: "To Yang Wang Xiu", to express repay and praise Zhou Wang's shelter. "The Book of Songs. Daya. "Jiang Han": "To Yang Wang Xiu". Also used as a name. The Han silk book expresses the answer, "Mawangdui silk book. Line 362 of the Old Unused Book after the First Volume of Lao Zi: "Yi Yin said in contrast."
